p: This was the first prospective cohort study of CHIKV-infected cases to be conducted in Martinique during the 2013-outbreak. The overall prevalence of chronic chikungunya in our cohort was 52.10% (CI 95% 44.50–59.70), which confirms that it is a common sequela after acute infection. Indeed, previous studies have reported prevalences ranging between 53.70% and 87.20% globally [ 6, 31– 33]—except in India, where prevalences have been shown to vary between 4.10% and 7.00% [ 46, 47] (possibly due to viral or population specificities).
